alert.note: Alert for Pulaski; Rockcastle (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 30 at 12:16AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Kentucky, including the following counties, Pulaski and Rockcastle. * WHEN...Until 315 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1215 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hansford, Level Green, Bloss, Sand Springs, Wabp, Bromo, Willailla, Pongo, Valley Oak, Spiro, Quail, Maretburg, Wellhope, Bandy, Woodstock, Luner, Ottowa and Bee Lick. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
